Articles.Content: Planted a flag at the KSC flag pole. Drove a rover to a nearby anomaly with the intent to 'flag' it as well but that was not a right click option. Is there a way to accomplish this short of taking a bus load of kerbals?

19 minutes ago, Red Shirt said:

Planted a flag at the KSC flag pole. Drove a rover to a nearby anomaly with the intent to 'flag' it as well but that was not a right click option. Is there a way to accomplish this short of taking a bus load of kerbals? 

Yes, you only get one flag per kerbal.  However, entering any sort of command pod replenishes the kerbal, so you can hop out, plant a flag, hop back in, repeat.  (Works the same way with EVA propellant.)

Note that the external command chair (i.e. what people often use on rovers) does not replace the flag.  So if you want to do this, either you need to bring a busload of kerbals, or you need to include a command pod on your rover.

Also note that flags are not reusable.  If you plant your 1 flag, then take it down, you can't plant it again.  You have to go back inside a command pod and get a new one.

Edited January 17, 2016 by Geschosskopf
